editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: WORKS OF THEOLOGY AND PASTORAL INSTRUCTION; S. XIV (I), c. 1478 (II-III)

physDesc.p: Three originally independent books, of which II is split by the insertion of III. I itself is in two parts, united by large red headings in the same hand. The first part may originally have followed the second, as it is in a rougher hand and is less decorated. All parts were together by s. xv.

supportDesc.extent:
252 leaves (iii + 248, incl. 231A) 265 190
The edges savagely retrimmed, with loss of text and running heads, and spattered with red. fol. 231A lacks the outer col., but no text.
supportDesc.foliation: Foliation of s. xv runs ii (mod. 3) – xxiiii (25), xxxviii (26) – clxxxxiiii (183), clxxxxvi (184) – cclvi (243), omitting modern fol. 101 by mistake.

handDesc.handNote: All parts written in anglicana: the two parts of I are in two similar hands; II is in a single hand, and III is in one hand or several similar ones.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rough red initials and titles; red highlighting and paraphs.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. fols. i-iii, 246–8 are paper binding leaves, the first two and the last from a printed Latin-English dictionary, s. xvi. On fol. iiiv is a table of contents, s. xvii.

history.provenance: All parts made in England, probably for a parish priest. At the head of fol. 245v is ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxon’ ut incathenetur in libraria eiusdem ex dono Magistri Henrici Seuer sacre theologie professoris. Oretis igitur pro eo’, in an anglicana hand influenced by humanistica. For Sever, see MS 6.
Near the foot of this leaf, towards the spine, is a rust-mark presumably from a chain-staple of uncertain form.

Inside the front board is a long table of contents and ‘N. 2. 1. Art’, s. xvii. Pasted on is a sheet of paper with pencilled ‘N. 2. 1’, canc. and replaced with ‘A. 1. 1. (XIII)’ in red. The College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, pp. 7–10; Powicke, no. 960; Römer 2. 299–300; Jirouskova, Die Visio Pauli: Wege und Wandlungen einer orientalischem Apokryphe im Lateinischen Mittelalter, pp. 106–8.

msItem.incipit: Qui mihi ministrat me sequitur. Io. 15. In his uerbis notantur duo; primum est Christo debita administracio

msItem.rubric: De natura angelorum
msItem.incipit: Nota super in S. angelis suis mandauit Deus &c. Notandum quod quia triplex est ierarchia celestis una est suprema
Deus caritas est ... ; Ysidorus Expedit iam probatos amare non amatos probare ...
Verbo Domini celi firmati sunt &c. Tria in hiis uerbis sunt notari primum omnium sacre scripture dignitas
Ecce reges terre congregati sunt. Ecce postillis ad uerbum demonstratum reges dicuntur prelati ecclesie
Fuit in diebus Herodis sacerdos quidam ...; Iste sacerdos commendatur autem 4. que debentur omnibus sacerdotibus
Iohannes est nomen eius. In uerbis istis commendatur sanctus iste quoad duo scilicet quoad sullimitatem uite

msItem.note: The originally blank fol. 10 col. 2 was filled with legal documents, apparently as pen-trials, s. xiv ex. One of these is a letter of William bishop of Lincoln dated 29 April 1371, but there was no William bishop of Lincoln then. Another names ‘Willelmus Ingram miles de Stapiletone’ and ‘Symon Attenoke’.

msItem.incipit: Erat magnus coram Domino ...; Quattuor modis ostenditur prerogatiua uel magnitudo Iohannis primo ratione originis humane
Es tu Christus ...; Hac si diceretur quoniam distat inter uocem et istum cuius est uox
Magis mortem gloriosam quam uitam odibilem ... ; Per istum sermonem tria possunt nominari. Primum est finis laudabile generositas
Corona est Maria. Per illum sermonum possunt duo notari primum est de interpretacione huius nominis Maria

msItem.note: For items 2, 51–4 see Part II.
For items 3–50 see Part III.

msItem.title: Eight sermons
msItem.note: on Ioh. 17: 1–26, extracted from Augustine, Tractatus in Iohannis Euang., 104. 2 – 111. 6

msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo primus beati Augustini in oratione
msItem.incipit: Subleuatis Iesus oculis ...; Poterat Dominus coeternus Pater iustificare sermo
Glorificatum a patre filium secundum formam serui
De hiis uerbis Domini sicut ipse donauerat
Cum de hiis quos iam discipulos habebat
Loquens adhuc Dominus ad patrem et orans pro discipulis suis
Dominus Iesus iam sua propinquante passione
Cum Dominus Iesus orasset pro discipulis quos tunc secum habebat
In magnam spem Dominus suos erigit
msItem.explicit: esset homo factus corpus eius sumus
msItem.finalRubric: Finita est Saluatoris oratio amen

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard
msItem.title: Speculum Conscientiae
msItem.incipit: Consciencia in qua est anima perpetua permansura edificanda est
msItem.explicit: si uolueris queuis malas cogitaciones a corde expellere hoc sepius cogita liberaberis Deo gratias
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber consciencie uel confessionis beati Bernardi abbatis
msItem.note: Without the prologue. Beg. as PL 184. 509, but the text here differs markedly from that in PL. Bloomfield 1787; many different titles and copies.

msItem.author: Robert Holcot
msItem.title: Conuertimini
msItem.incipit: Conuertimini ad me in toto corde uestro. Ioel i. c. Et nota quod iiii. requiruntur ad hoc quod peccator conuertatur
msItem.explicit: (ends unfinished in Hortamur uos) perdunt quasi eorum ymagines in corde
msItem.note: On fol. 212v are capitula.
unpr.; Bloomfield 0989, not this copy.

msItem.title: Constitutiones Clementinae
msItem.incipit: Fidei catholice fundamento preter quod teste apostolo nemo potest aliter ponere firmiter inherentes
msItem.explicit: (ends unfinished in 3. 10. 2) extra sublata actione quacunque ad confessionem
msItem.note: Preceded by capitula. E. Friedberg, Corpus Iuris Canonici (2 vols, Leipzig, 1897, 1881), II, pp. 1132–67.

The bifolium fols. 244–5 contains (a) on fol. 244rv a table of contents to the whole book, s. xv, showing that the ‘Speculum presbiterorum’ (presumably Bloomfield 4923) began on the original fol. 27, and is now lost; the next item began on the original f. 37; (b) on fols. 244v-5 a subject-index to the lost ‘Speculum’, plus three entries for the next art.

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 200–30 150–70 , frame-ruled with crayon in 2 cols, written in c. 40 lines.

msItem.title: Vita S. Augustini
msItem.rubric: Incipit uita sancti Augustini magni doctoris et episcopi Yponensis instructoris canonicorum
msItem.incipit: Beatum Augustinum magnum fuisse doctorem catholicum et pre cuncta laudabilis papa Celestinus hiis uerbis asseruit
msItem.explicit: (ends unfinished) Nec tamen iam ideo mihi catholicam uiam tenendam
msItem.note: The Life (BHL 789), consisting almost wholly of extracts from the Confessiones, is known from several copies, mostly English, as early as s. xii, e.g. CCCC 34, Cambridge, Peterhouse 179.
For items 3–54 see Part III

msItem.title: Gospel of Nicodemus
msItem.rubric: Incipit euangelium Nazareorum secundum Nichodemum
msItem.incipit: Factum est in anno decimo nono imperii Tyberii Cesaris Romanorum
msItem.explicit: que gesta sunt de Iesu in pretorio meo
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit euangelium Nichodemi quod dicitur euangelium Nazareorum
msItem.note: ed. H. C. Kim (Toronto, 1973); Stegmüller, Bibl. 179. 27 &c.; Geerard, Clavis Apocryphorum, no. 62; Z. Izydorczyk, Manuscripts of the Euangelium Nicodemi: A Census (Toronto, 1993), no. 244.

msItem.title: Dialogus Beatae Mariae et Anselmi de Passione Domini
msItem.rubric: Incipit interlocutio Sancti Anselmi Cantuariensis archiepiscopi ad beatam uirginem Mariam de passione filii sui Domini nostri Ihesu Christi quomodo factum est Iherusalem
msItem.incipit: Sanctus Anselmus Cantuariensis archiepiscopus doctor theologie eximius uita et moribus preclarus
msItem.explicit: pacem in diebus nostris per dies sempiternos. Vale &c.
msItem.note: PL 159. 271–90, here ending at col. 288, as in other copies, followed by a pious ejaculation. On fols. 194v-5a are short extracts from Augustine.

msItem.title: Vado Mori
msItem.incipit: Ad mortem tendo morti mea carmina pendo
msItem.explicit: Nam mortem uereor, mors omnia salutat usque
msItem.note: Bloomfield 0265, this copy only; cf. WIC 19965. Followed by theological notes running into the lower margin.

msItem.title: Versus de tribus regibus Coloniae
msItem.rubric: De tribus regibus quiescentibus Colonie
msItem.incipit: Caspar fert mirram, thus Melchior Baltazar aurum, horum facta regum monstrabit prosula trium. Hii tres reges sunt Indorum
msItem.explicit: Soluitur a morbo domi in pietate caduco

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 210 155 , frame-ruled, written in 43 long lines.

msItem.title: Gospel of Ps.-Matthew
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf. in 1. 1) timens Dominum in simplicitate et bonitate sua

msItem.title: Gospel of Ps.-Thomas
msItem.incipit: Ego Thomas Ysmaelita scripsi
msItem.explicit: uidit Dominus Deus Israel a primo usque ad ultimum
msItem.rubric: De nomine collectoris et auctoris libri
msItem.incipit: Ego autem Thomas Ysmaelita semper peccator
msItem.explicit: hec collegi de dispersis scriptis et miraculis per loca. Que nullatenus uoluit Deus abscondi nec a memoria hominum detegi, Ipsi honor et gloria in s. s. amen

msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de infancia Christi
msItem.note: M. Geerard, Clavis Apocryphorum Novi Testamenti (Turnhout, 1992), nos 51, 57. Ps.-Matthew ed. J. Gijsel in CCSL Series Apocryphorum 9 (1999), pp. 287–481, this copy at pp. 170–1; Gijsel, Die unmittelbare Textüberlieferung des sog. Pseudo-Matthäus (Brussels, 1981), pp. 205–6. Ps.-Thomas ed. C. Tischendorf, Evangelia apocrypha (Leipzig, 2nd edn. 1876/repr. Hildesheim, 1987), pp. 140–57. Followed by:

msItem.incipit: Beatus Ieronimus dicit. Beata uirgo Maria mater Domini nostri Iesu Christi fuit in etate xiiii. annorum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de infancia Saluatoris d. n. I. C. cum miraculis maximis
msItem.note: An extract from the Latin version of Epiphanius’ Life of the Virgin, ed. E. Franceschini, Studi e note di filologia lat. medievale (Milan, 1938), pp. 107–28, from Oxford, Balliol Coll., MS 227, fols. 146v-51v. These three items together are typical of the Q family of Ps.-Matthew, this copy Gijsel’s Q4b2. Crammed in on either side of the concluding rubric, by the same scribe, is a paragraph ‘Augustinus de Virginibus dicit quod admiracione omni populo Israel ...’.

msItem.author: Honorius Augustodunensis
msItem.title: Elucidarius
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber elucidarius beati Anselmi doctoris
msItem.incipit: Sepius rogatus a discipulo quasdam questiunculas enodare
msItem.explicit: de consuetudine necessitas de necessitate desperacio
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit elucidarius beati Anselmi doctoris et Cantuariencis archiepiscopi
msItem.note: The full text PL 172. 1109–76; Y. Lefèvre, L’Elucidarium et les lucidaires (Paris, 1954), pp. 361–477.

msItem.title: Vita et Sententiae Secundi Philosophi
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Secundi philosophi quem scripsit Adriano Romanorum imperatori deposcenti ipsum
msItem.incipit: Secundus philosophus omni tempore philosophatus est silencium et Pictatoricam uitam ducens
msItem.explicit: libros sacre bibliotece inseri et intitulari
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Secundi philosophi ad Adrianum imperatorem
msItem.note: ed. A. Hilka, Leben und Sentenzen des Philosophus Secundus (Breslau, 1910), pp. 8–23, and W. Suchier, Illinois Studies in Language and Literature 24, 2 (1939), pp. 152–9, repr. B. E. Perry, Secundus the Silent Philosopher (Ithaca, NY, 1964), pp. 92–100; cf. eTK 1423K, but beg. as eTK 1424B, cited from the excerpted version in Basel, Universitätsbibl. O. IV. 35, fol. 26rv.

msItem.title: Prouerbia Wiponis
msItem.incipit: Pax Henrico Dei amico
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit
msItem.note: WIC 13898. Followed by brief theological notes.

msItem.title: Anon. Commentary on the Lord’s Prayer
msItem.incipit: Pater noster qui es. Hic incipit tabula de utilitate orationis dominice
Dicit Pater noster tanquam caput omnium orationum euidenter approbatur
Ista oratio est breuis quinque de causis
msItem.note: Bloomfield 8834, citing this copy and four others, all apparently English.

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Meditatio 1
msItem.rubric: Incipit meditacio beati Anselmi archiepiscopi
msItem.incipit: Terret me uita mea tota
msItem.note: SAO 3. 76–9. Followed by short notes: ‘Sanctus Paulus dixit hec uerba ad Neronem. Quecumque sunt pacis et caritatis ...’, ‘Hec est oracio beati Ambrosii archiepiscopi ad sacerdotes circa eucharista. Si tantum reatum delinquencie nostre ...’, also quoting Bede, Augustine and Peter of Blois.

msItem.title: Spiritus Guidonis
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber alloquiorum de spiritu Gwydonis
msItem.incipit: Augustinus de fide ad Petrum libro dicit miraculum quicquid arduum uel supra facultatem hominis ad fidei roboracionem fit
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber alloquiorum de spiritu Gwydonis
msItem.note: The apparition is alleged to have occurred on 26 Dec. 1323. unpr.; many copies; see Cat. Royal MSS, p. 173 (on BL, Roy. 7 B. xiii, art. 2).

msItem.author: Ps.-Methodius
msItem.title: Reuelationes
msItem.rubric: In nomine Christi incipit liber et historia Metodii episcopi Patriensis uel Paterensis ecclesie et martyris Christi quem de Hebreo et Greco sermone in Latinum beatus Ieronimus transferre curauit
msItem.incipit: Hic est de principio seculi, de regnis gencium et de fine seculorum. Quem illustris uir Beatus Ieronimus doctor in suis opusculis plane collaudauit. Sciendum est nobis f. k. quomodo in principio creauit Deus celum et terram
msItem.explicit: unde nos Dominus eripere dignetur qui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber beati Metodii episcopi Paterensis et martiris
msItem.note: ed. E. Sackur, Sibyllinische Texte und Forschungen (Halle, 1898/Torino, 1963), pp. 59–96; O. Prinz, ‘Eine frühe abendländische Aktualisierung der lateinischen Übersetzung des Pseudo-Methodius’, Deutsches Archiv 41 (1985), 1–23.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Epistola ad Cyrillum (Epist. app. 18)
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola beati Augustini Yponensis episcopi et doctoris ad beatum Cirillum Ierosolimitanum episcopum de apparicione beati Ieronimi doctoris et presbiteri cardinalis
msItem.incipit: Gloriosissime Christiane fidei atlete
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Beati Augustini Yponensis episcopi ad sanctum Cirillum Ierosolimitanum episcopum de apparicione beati Ieronimi doctoris cardinalis presbiteri et abbatis Bethleemite

msItem.author: Ps.-Cyril
msItem.title: Epistola ad Augustinum (Epist. app. 19)
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola sancti Cirilli Ierosolimitani episcopi ad beatum Augustinum Yponensem episcopum de miraculis beati Ieronimi doctoris cardinalis presbiteri abbatis Beth’
msItem.incipit: Venerabili uiro episcoporum eximie Augustino
Illius scilicet Ieronimi gloriosi cuius memoria erit in benedictione
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt epistole siue libri sanctorum Augustini et Cirilli episcoporum de apparicionibus et miraculis beati Ieronimi
msItem.note: PL 33. 1126–40. Followed by a short table of the main subdivisions of each letter.

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard of Clairvaux (Bernard Silvestris)
msItem.title: Epistola ad Raymundum
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola beati Bernardi abbatis Clareuallensis ad quendam militem nomine Reymundum dominum Castri Ambrosii de re familiari utilius gubernanda sagaciter descripta
msItem.incipit: Gratioso et felici militi Reymundo
Doceri petisti a nobis de cura et modo rei familiaris utilius gubernande
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit epistola Bernardi de re familiari gubernanda sagaciter

msItem.title: Letter of Christ about Sunday
msItem.rubric: Hic incipit epistola Domini nostri Iesu Christi Saluatoris mundi
msItem.incipit: Ego angelus et nuncius Domini Saluatoris mando et remando imperatoribus ac regibus omnibus
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit epistola Domini Dei nostri tradita Petro Antiochensi episcopo de obseruacione sancte dominice diei et aliis obseruanda et quibusdam omittenda
msItem.note: Geerard, Clavis Apocryphorum, no. 311, pp. 191–2 for the various editions of the Latin version. The standard one is J. A. Fabricius, Codex Apocryphus Novi Testamenti, I (Hamburg, 2nd edn., 1719), pp. 309–13.

msItem.title: Epitaph
msItem.rubric: Versus in epitafio apud Sanctum Paulum
msItem.incipit: Vermibus hic donor et sic intendere conor
msItem.note: (a quatrain) WIC 20209.

msItem.title: Visio Pauli
msItem.rubric: Incipit reuelacio sancti Pauli hiis tribus diebus que conuersus et uocatus a Christo cecidit in terram nihil uidens
msItem.incipit: Dies dominicus dies electus in quo gaudent angeli
msItem.explicit: possent narrare omnes penas inferni usque in diem iudicii
msItem.note: ed. L. Jirouskova, Die Visio Pauli: Wege und Wandlungen einer orientalischem Apokryphe im Lateinischen Mittelalter (Leiden, 2006), pp. 653–854 (her Group C3).

msItem.author: William de Lavicea
msItem.title: Dieta Salutis
msItem.rubric: Incipit prohemium in librum qui dicitur dieta salutis quem frater Guillelmus Aquitanicus composuit
msItem.incipit: Hec est uia, ambulate in ea
msItem.explicit: que est infinita, ad quam nos perducat qui ...
msItem.note: ed. A. C. Peltier, S. Bonaventurae Opera Omnia (Paris, 1864–71), VIII, pp. 247–347; Distelbrink 124; Bloomfield 2301.

msItem.title: subject-index
msItem.note: accidia—ydolatria, ending ‘Explicit liber qui dicitur dieta salutis. 1478.’

msItem.rubric: Reuelaciones Alberti archiepiscopi Coloniensis
msItem.incipit: Sanctus Albertus archiepiscopus Coloniensis celebrando missam habuit reuelaciones scriptorum istorum sermonum quos ipse retinuit in corde suo et postea scripsit in libro

msItem.rubric: De sancto Thoma apostolo
msItem.incipit: Sanctus Thomas apostolus qui dicitur Didimus quiescit corporaliter in India prope Cylandiam
msItem.explicit: Et si hoc non faceret Indi a fide perirerent

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Dialogus Quaestionum LXV
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber 65 questionum propositarum ab Orosio doctore et a beato Augustino doctore Yponensi episcopi expositarum
msItem.incipit: Licet multi et probatissimi
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Orosii et beati Augustini in questionibus et responsionibus collocucio

msItem.rubric: Sentencie et responsiones ex libris beati Augustini excerpte aduersum Manacheos et questiones eorum. Incipiunt sentencie et responsiones ex libris beati Augustini excerpte aduersum Manacheos et questiones eorum
msItem.incipit: Quare fecit Deus hominem quem peccaturum sciebat
msItem.explicit: (ends unfinished on fol. 109 col. a) quia ipso die cepit requiescere a creacione
msItem.note: The work then begins all over again on fol. 110, ending on fol. 114v ‘quam ipsi non fecerat adiuuari potenciam suam.’ Beg. as Augustine, De Genesi contra Manicheos, bk. 2. Fol. 109v blank.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine (Prosper)
msItem.title: Responsiones ad Capitula Calumniantium Gallorum
msItem.incipit: Prosper. Doctrina quam sancte memorie Augustinus episcopus et doctor contra Pelagianos
Quod ex predestinacione Dei uelud fatali necessitate homines
msItem.note: PL 45. 1833–44; 51. 155–74. Followed by a note on the Jews (‘Quot secte Iudeorum. Quot fuerunt secte Iudeorum qui fuerunt separati a communi uita ...’), and extracts from Augustine, Jerome and Ambrose. fols. 116v-17v.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine (Quodvultdeus)
msItem.title: Contra Iudaeos, Paganos et Arianos Sermo de Symbolo
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini Yponensis episcopi et doctoris de confutacione Iudeorum
msItem.incipit: Vos inquam conuenio O Iudei qui usque in hodiernum diem negastis Filium Dei
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber beati Augustini episcopi et doctoris de confutacione Iudeorum per testimonia sacre scripture
msItem.note: CPL 404; PL 42. 1123–7. Preceded by an extract from Richard of St Victor, Liber Exceptionum

msItem.author: Ambrosius Autpertus
msItem.title: De Conflictu Vitiorum et Virtutum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini de conflictu uirtutum et uiciorum sic
msItem.incipit: Videamus quemadmodum castra Dei et inferni dimicent
msItem.explicit: repereris hunc legendum et aliis debes
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit libellus beati Augustini Yponensi episcopi
msItem.note: PL 40. 1093–1106; Bloomfield 0455.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De Paenitentibus (Serm. 393)
msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo beati Augustini episcopi de penitencia, confessione et indulgencia
msItem.incipit: Penitentes penitentes penitentes
msItem.explicit: Dimitte itaque inceptum et tene certum
msItem.note: PL 39. 1713–15. The incipit was written at the head of fol. 121v col. a, left blank, and the incipit repeated at the foot. The text occupies 121v col. b and 122 col. a only. At the foot of fol. 120 is a note ‘Sed dicitis Quid est bene uiuere post penitenciam?’

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Institutione Nouitiorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore canonici regularis ordinis sancti Augustini de instructione nouiciorum
msItem.incipit: Non preter solitum facere quosdam iudicabo si presenti tractatu meo derogauerint
msItem.note: (capitula)
msItem.incipit: Quia largiente Domino de uana conuersacione huius mundi
msItem.explicit: Bonitatem uero orate, ut det uobis Deus amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber magistri Hugonis de Sancto Vitore doctoris studii Parisiensis canonici regularis de instructione nouiciorum ordinandorum in religione
msItem.note: PL 176. 925–52, without the first prologue; Goy, pp. 340–67, not this copy.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Virtute Orandi
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber magistri Hugonis de orandi modo
msItem.incipit: Domino et patri Th. Hugo munusculum hoc dilectionis mee
Quo studio et quo affectu a nobis orandus sit Deus
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber magistri Hugonis de orandi modo
msItem.note: ed. H. B. Feiss et al., L’Oeuvre de Hugues de Saint-Victor 1 (Turnhout, 1997), pp. 126–71; Goy, p. 425.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Amore Sponsi ad Sponsam
msItem.rubric: Magister Hugo de sancto Victore de hoc quod scribitur in Cantica
msItem.incipit: Ibo mihi ad montem mirre et ad colles Libani et loquar sponse mee. Sponsus quidam hic loquitur qui habet sponsam
msItem.explicit: tanto magis in unum congregamur amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus Magistri H. de Ibo mihi

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Meditatione
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de meditacione quomodo disponetur animus deprecantis ad Deum
msItem.incipit: Meditacio est frequens cogitacio modum et causam
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit M. Hugo de meditatione
msItem.note: ed. R. Baron, Hugues de Saint-Victor: Six Opuscules spirituels (Paris, 1969), pp. 44–59; Goy, p. 205.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Refectione Verbi Dei
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de refectione uerbi Dei
msItem.incipit: In refeccione duo sunt potus et cibus
msItem.explicit: ue hiis qui de bono deteriores fiunt
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Magister Hugo de refectione uerbi Dei

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Quinque Septenis
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de quinque septenis
msItem.incipit: Quinque septena fol. in sacra scriptura inueni
msItem.explicit: memento mei. Gracia Dei sit tecum amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Magister H. de quinque septenis
msItem.note: ed. Baron, pp. 100–18; Goy, p. 377; Bloomfield 4833.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Oblivione Praeteritorum Malorum et Memoria
msItem.rubric: Incipit Magister H. de Sancto Victore de obliuione preteritorum malorum et memoria
msItem.incipit: Insipientem doctus interrogas. Queris quid tibi faciendum sit
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus Magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de obliuione preteritorum malorum et cautela
msItem.note: Misc. I. 74; PL 177. 509–10; Bloomfield 2686.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: Misc. I. 99
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus magistri Hugonis de iudicio faciendo
msItem.incipit: Quid retribuam Domino pro omnibus ...; O homo quid sit bonum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus Magistri Hugonis de iudicio
msItem.note: PL 177. 530–2, here beg. at 531A.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Substantia Dilectionis
msItem.rubric: Incipit Magister Hugo de Sancto Victore de substancia dilectionis
msItem.incipit: Cotidianum de dilectione sermonem
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit ...
msItem.note: ed. Baron, pp. 82–93; Goy, p. 395.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Archa Noe morali
msItem.note: excerpt
msItem.rubric: Magister Hugo de Sancto Victore in libro de archa Noe ponit hoc
msItem.incipit: Tribus modis per contemplacionem audimus omnem creaturam nobis loquentem
msItem.note: PL 176. 617–80; Goy, p. 236, but the passage is not found there, at least verbatim.
Followed by verses, crammed into the rest of the col.: ‘Incremat, siccat, distillat, leniat, urit’.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: Misc. I, 172
msItem.rubric: Magister Hugo de Sancto Victore quot modis diabolus humilitatem impugnat
msItem.incipit: Duobus modis diabolus in nobis humilitatem oppugnat
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit ...
msItem.note: PL 177. 565–7; Bloomfield 1837.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: Misc. I, 95
msItem.rubric: Incipit Magister Hugo de tribus locis sacre scripture
msItem.incipit: Tria sunt loca Egyptus, desertum et terra promissionis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit ...

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: Misc. I, 77
msItem.rubric: Incipit Magister Hugo de quinque statibus mutabilitatis humane
msItem.incipit: Quinque status habet uita humana
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit ...

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Arrha Animae
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de arra anime
msItem.incipit: Dilecto fratri G. ceterisque seruis Christi
Loquar secreto anime mee
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de arra anime in soliloquiis

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Laude Caritatis
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de laude caritatis
msItem.incipit: Seruo Christi Petro Hugo gustare et uidere quoniam suauis est Dominus
Tam multos iam laudatores caritas habuisse cognoscitur
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore doctoris studii Parisiensis de caritate
msItem.note: ed. Feiss et al. (1997), pp. 182–207; Goy, pp. 253–67, not this copy.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Beatae Mariae Virginitate
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus siue tractatus magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de uirginitate et matrimonio beate Marie
msItem.incipit: Sancto pontifici G. Hugo uestre beatitudinis seruus
De incorrupta uirginitate matris Domini
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus siue libellus de uirginitate beate Marie secundum Hugonem de Sancto Victore
msItem.note: PL 176. 857–76; ed. and transl. B. Jollés, L’Oeuvre de Hugues de Saint-Victor 2 (Turnhout, 2000), pp. 182–253; Goy, p. 120.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: De Vanitate Mundi
De Sacramentis Legis Naturalis et Scriptae Dialogus
msItem.note: Both as one work
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber primus magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore doctoris studii Parisiensis de creacione mundi
msItem.incipit: Ratio querit sic. O munde inmunde
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber primus
msItem.incipit: Anima. Quid fuit prius quam mundus fieret?
msItem.explicit: Hoc Dei iudicio relinquendum mihi uidetur
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit secundus liber magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de mundo
msItem.note: The first book (Goy, pp. 245–53, not this copy), as in PL 176. 703–20; the second book (Goy, p. 78) as in PL 176. 17–42.

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor (?)
msItem.title: Commentary on pseudo-Athanasius, De Trinitate
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt dicta et approbaciones magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore super sentencias beati Athanasii Alexandrini episcopi
msItem.incipit: Veritatis propugnaculi turris Athanasius, sicut tripartita docet historia
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt dicta et approbaciones Magistri Hugonis prioris et doctoris de Sancto Victore super solidas sentencias beati Athanasii Alexandrini episcopi doctoris eximii in explanacione fidei Christiane et condempnatione hereticorum
msItem.note: A commentary on pseudo-Athanasius, De Trinitate (PL 62. 237–334). Sections of text, ascr. Athanasius, alternate with commentary ascr. Hugo. unpr.; apparently the unique copy.

msItem.title: Miracula
msItem.rubric: Incipit miraculum de sacramento altaris ad extirpandum heresim inimicorum Christi et omnem dubitacionem ipsius
msItem.incipit: Omnibus uniuersalis ecclesie filiis tam prelatis quam subditis H. Karoli Loco monachus
Catholice f. k. cum unum sit corpus ecclesie
Erat igitur Mantue quidam sacerdos bone uite
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit miraculum de corpore Christi apud Mantuam

msItem.title: Miracula
msItem.rubric: Incipit miraculum de corpore Christi per Phegum quendam sacerdotem in Teutonia comprobatum
msItem.incipit: Sacerdos quidam nacione Teutonicus nomine Phegus

msItem.rubric: Miraculum de sacramento altaris
msItem.incipit: Legitur quod quidam Iudeus adamauit puellam Christianam iuuenculam
Erat homo quidam in Hibernia circa annos Domini MCCCCXX septimi

msItem.author: Gregory
msItem.title: Hom. de Divite et Lazaro
msItem.rubric: Dixit Iesus discipulis suis parabola hanc Homo quidam erat diues et induebatur purpura ...; Omelia beati Gregorii pape
msItem.incipit: Nonnulli putant precepta ueteris testamenti
msItem.note: Hom. in Evang. II. 40. 3. Followed by two stories of miracles of the Virgin:

msItem.rubric: De quodam presbytero qui semper cantabat missam de requiem eternam et ideo apud episcopum suum accusato
msItem.incipit: Fuit presbiter quidam qui nullam missam cantabatur nisi solam requiem eternam
Anno Domini MCCCC XXI quedam mulier Christiana seruiebat Iudeo ceco

msItem.title: Seven homilies attrib. Maximus the Confessor, Jerome, Bede and Origen

msItem.incipit: Ante dies deuocionum sancte quadragesime predicantes
msItem.note: Maximus 66; Paul the Deacon i. 75

msItem.incipit: Audistis k. sicut euangelica tuba cecinit
msItem.note: Ps.-Maximus 37; Paul the Deacon i. 80

msItem.incipit: Conflictus iste mirabilis
msItem.note: Ps.-Maximus 42; Paul the Deacon i. 81

msItem.incipit: Hec secunda parabola est cum interpretacione sua
msItem.note: Jerome, In Matt. ii. 13. 24; Paul the Deacon ii. 92

msItem.incipit: Commendat nobis beatissimus euuangelista et apostolus Iohannes priuilegium
msItem.note: Apparently also in Gotha, Forschungsbibl., Memb. I 68 (s. xiv/xv), fols. 159v-60v.

msItem.incipit: Docente in monte Domino discipuli uenerunt ad eum
msItem.note: Origen lat. 6; Paul the Deacon i. 61

msItem.incipit: Ingrediente domino in nauiculam
msItem.note: Origen lat. 7; Paul the Deacon i. 64

msItem.rubric: Anecdota de SS. Bonifacio et Thecla uirgine
De sancto Bonefacio martyre
msItem.incipit: Temporibus Diocletiani impiissimi imperatoris erat quedam mulier Rome nomine Aglaes filia quidem Acii proconsulis

msItem.rubric: De Sancta Tecla uirgine
msItem.incipit: Paulo apostolo predicante uerbum Dei inter alios credidit puella quedam uirgo Tecla nomine

msItem.rubric: Excerpta libri beati Augustini de fide Christiana et regule theologice
msItem.incipit: Aliud est nosse regulas connexionum, aliud sentenciarum ueritatem
msItem.note: Beg. as AUGUSTINE, De Doctrina Christiana 2. 34. Followed by two apparently separate notes in the same hand on fol. 182, the first quoting Nicholas de Lyra.

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 200–10 145–60 , frame-ruled with pencil in 2 cols, written in c. 50–60 lines.

supportDesc.extent:
the third and fourth leaves of a quire from another book
205 100

collation.signatures: There are remains of quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form: v iii and v iiii.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 52 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a small note-hand. At the head of fol. 2 a later hand has added ‘Ordinatum est quod tria grana ordei sicca et rotunda faciunt pollicem ...’.

decoDesc.decoNote: A blue initial, flourished in red, prominent red or green paraphs, flourished in the other colour.
